H0.text: Conclusion is the pond water without phosphates that Lea uses in her investigation of how phosphates affect oxygen levels in pond water.

H1.text: Hypothesis is the pond water without phosphates that Lea uses to investigate how phosphates affect oxygen levels in pond water.

H2.text: The pond water without phosphates would be the control group in Lea's investigation of how phosphates affect oxygen levels in pond water.

H3.text: Experimental group is the portion of Lea's investigation that uses pond water containing no phosphates to examine how phosphates affect oxygen levels in pond water.

A4.text: it is essential that the items or patients assigned to treatment and control groups be representative of the same population.
